stages.label: Pre
stages.title: Pre-treatment
stages.description: Where you are now - learning about DBT and preparing for the journey ahead

stages.title: Stage 1: Behavioral Control
stages.description: Focus on life-threatening behaviors, therapy-interfering behaviors, and quality of life issues

stages.title: Stage 2: Emotional Experiencing
stages.description: Processing trauma and developing emotional resilience

stages.title: Stage 3: Building Your Life
stages.description: Achieving individual goals and creating meaning in your life

therapyExperience.title: Collaborative Partnership
therapyExperience.description: Your therapist works with you as a partner, helping you learn and practice skills while addressing your individual challenges

therapyExperience.title: Practical Focus
therapyExperience.description: Sessions focus on skill-building, problem-solving current issues, and applying DBT techniques to your daily life.

timeInvestment.title: Weekly Commitment
timeInvestment.description: Individual therapy sessions plus skills group (if applicable). Expect 2-4 hours per week including homework and practice.

timeInvestment.title: Daily Practice
timeInvestment.description: 10-30 minutes of skill practice, diary cards, and mindfulness exercises.

timeInvestment.title: Duration
timeInvestment.description: Most people benefit from 6 months to 2 years of DBT, depending on individual needs and goals.
